Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 7cbff67c14e1d33d2d77dd4b7adcf42426d64a1e
What does "Jordan" mean?  If this is something for your own internal purposes, please remove.  Generally these files should look just like everyone else's.

Do you want this in /bin or /usr/libexec?  Please read:

https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/669d6fdd34a76eb78a280b6701e4eac9a5a9c37c/anti-patterns.md#incorrect-placement-of-executables-in-sbin-usrsbin-or-bin-usrbin
This is a really big script to not be using "-e"
Please format with `beautysh`.  Don't mix with tabs and spaces.
Please format with beautysh for consistency.
Mixed tabs and spaces.  Please use 4-space indentation.
Not sure why this is necessary.  It appears that you are installing files.
It seems like adding this variable will create a ipk package in the build directory. But there appears no data inside the data.tar.xz file. I will remove it.

Please format with prettier for consistency.  Generally we use 4-space indentation everywhere.

A number of lines with excess whitespace.
mixed tabs and spaces.  You can use 'prettier' to clean this up.
I don't think we desire seeing new systems with this.  That interface is deprecated and has security issues.  Is there a specific feature you are gaining by this that isn't covered with Redfish?
I just added for another way to get information from BMC not for any special usage. I will remove it.

Actually, I am not sure what this configuration does. Previously, I used phosphor-hwmon package to monitor sensors, and it requires this configuration so that I can get the sensor data via Redfish. Now, I am using entity-manager which already create an object under redfish/v1/Chassis.
Why is this file named ".in"?  Doesn't appear like you have any processing anywhere that modifies it.
I want to replace the original phosphor-softpoweroff that build from phosphor-ipmi-host package. Should I rename this file?
Yeah, just name it the same as the file in that repository and use a do_install step (if needed) to overwrite it on install.
Ok, I have renamed the file name.
No, I want to skip the original phosphor-softpoweroff. The utility will need org.openbmc.HostIpmi service which require phosphor-ipmi-bt package.
Please don't globally disable shellcheck.  Fix the issues.
There is a Yocto change coming that moves to libgpio2 which doesn't need gpiofind.
I have modified the command line to the tool that build from libgpio-2.0-rc3.

I have reformat the trailing spaces and the indentation with prettier and beautysh. It seem like the error send from Jenkins is generated by the power control command which will used the libgpiod2.0-rc tool.
This remark lead me to believe that this commit was ready for review, but the first 3 files still have unaddressed changes.  Please don't mark things done if they're not done.
Those changes are still in my local repository. Sorry sir, next time will check more carefully.

I suspect you have a spelling mistake here.

https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-pid-control/blob/79cde00af75a15e60fa91a367b49421baf8530cf/pid/buildjson.cpp#L48
Looks like a `prettier` miss on this file.
Remove this file since all_sensor object have been created in xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper. Also, remove the phosphor-inventroy-manager_%bbappend file.
Fix some remaining issues and remove unused files.
